Reviews.Title: Very good TV for the price.The sound is better than most.
Reviews.Author: dmd93
Reviews.Content: I am a maintenance director at a nursing home and I buy 32 inch LCD's for resident rooms.I have purchased about 6 different brands from Amazon in the past 9 months.I like this one the best and plan on only buying these from now on.This unit has an excellent picture with good black level's for an LCD.The sound on it is very good for a flat panel.There is a much better amount of clear bass and treble compared to the other brands that I have purchased.I like the fact that it has an SD card slot on the side.That makes it very easy for someone to show photos.SD seems to be taking over as the required memory in camera's.It doesn't have a USB slot which would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: MLipenk
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 2nd TV for our less often used family space in our lower level.  My only requirements were that it be reasonably priced, at least 32", and interface with my older DVD player with component connections, and my older VCR with composite connections (yes, my kids still watch the occasional VHS movie).  Frankly I didn't care if it was internet connectable for Netflix, or had a specific refresh rate.  After viewing a bunch of TVs and brands side by side at my local "Good Purchase" store, including generic knock-off brands, it was clear this model of Panasonic simply had the best picture for the price.  The contrast, colors, and view-ability of the IPS panel really stood out against other TVs in this price range. After checking Amazon, Amazon had the lowest price anywhere.  The box came with a hole in the side, but I guess that is not necessarily the fault of Amazon.  Still the TV is not double-boxed when shipped, so fortunately whatever made the hole did not get through far enough to damage the TV.  The TV was easy to affix to the stand (8 screws total) and the setup of the channels is VERY easy. The TV displays instructions for each step of the way so you always know what is going to happen or what to do if you want to exit a menu area. Of course at 32" it does seem a bit smallish compared to my awesome Sharp 46" TV in our main family room, but it will suffice for the amount it will get used.  Of course it would be nice to have double the connections on the back, so I guess realistically I would give it 4.5 stars out of 5, but it does come with 2 HDMI, 1 Component, and 1 Composite. For the price of this TV it is what I would expect.  I would rather have  fewer connections and a quality picture than a sub-par picture with twice the connections. This would also make an excellent TV for a bedroom and for that you would likely not need that many connections anyway. Panasonic has a sleeper with this gem with its quality picture, IPS panel and at a very competitive price $three-twenty-nine with free shipping!

Reviews.Title: Very nice budget HDTV
Reviews.Author: Christopher Joseph
Reviews.Content: Just received mine today. Was quite easy to set up once I figured out the stand slides into a panel at the bottom of the TV. I own a Panasonic 42" and set this one to the same settings since there are no real calibrations posted online yet since it's a newer model. It looks very good and comparable to the 42". Black/night scenes seem a little soft but it's nothing to really complain about.Pros:Price ($343 1 day shipping)Sound Quality - I was replacing a 2007 Sony LCD and this sound blows the other away. I did hook it up to external speakers but the sound out of the box is not bad at all.Picture Quality - If 720p is fine for you you should have no problems with this TV. Non-HD channels are average quality and the HD ones are nice.Weight - It was surprisingly light, only 22 pounds with stand and 19 withoutCons:Only 2 HDMI portsI was not able to program my cable remote using the codes provided for Panasonic. That may be because it's a newer TV but this may be annoying to some people.So if you're in the market for a budget HDTV I would highly recommend this one. It's very user friendly and Panasonic has good quality products.

Reviews.Title: Super picture quality and viewing angles
Reviews.Author: Rayaz
Reviews.Content: Brought this to replace my aging Acer 32" LCD brought several years ago. Did not want to change the size due to the smallish room that i currently have the TV fixed, and decided against FullHD, as most of the contents i watch are not even 720p, hence a waste of cash. Checked out several products including products from Sony (BX300 and BX320), Samsung (C350 and 450), Sharp, Philips, LG, etc.Found the Samsung, Sony and Panasonic were among the better panels with richer colors in the budget 32" market. Samsung had the advantage on features, Sony on features, with Panasonic playing middle ground.  However the Sony BX320 had some issues with tearing when playing videos (I did not notice, but seen on several forums) and decided against it though i liked the built in FM tuner (takes away the need for a radio in the room).  The Samsung had very little to fault, and also provided the most features with its built in USB media play back capable of playing all formats, including NTFS drives, however the habit of Samsung using different panels made me look around.The Panasonic C3 just appeared into the market as the 2011 model, and has panel that seems to be much better than the the Samsung and Sony to my eyes, and this was my key decision maker.  The Panasonic also had good viewing angles and a good feature set.I tried several file formats using a USB drive (FLV, MKV, XVid, Divx) and they played with no issues.  The colors as vibrant, and i reduced the back lighting from the default 100, as i did not need that so much.  The asian model features both an USB and SD card, while the US version only has SD card.Some areas that i felt could improveAvoid setting the picture mode to Dynamic, as the software tries to optimize based on the content, and the algorithm is still not that great.Audio from the built speakers are decent and loud, but muted when playing files from the built-in video player.  There is absolutely no Bass in the speakers.Only two HDMI ports, most rival models provide 3-4PC connectivity is only through an analog port, no DVI portRemote does not have any quick buttons for commonly used features (such as picture mode, sound mode, etc)

Reviews.Title: Great Value, but ...
Reviews.Author: Matt Andrews
Reviews.Content: I found this offered at the lowest price to date ($299) and decided to order one for the bedroom.It arrived as & when promised. I unboxed and set it up which was very simple. I discovered the included (factory) remote didn't operate the set and had to use the buttons on the side of the TV for the initial settings.I determined the remote was operable but the television was not 'seeing' it through the IR sensor (TV's remote control infrared sensor). I called Panasonic's service number and explained the issue. After some back & forth, it was determined the four (4) screws that hold the table top base to the TV can short out the IR sensor. Backing those screws off a few turns fixed the problem!Live & Learn ~ Like many things, it's all good until someone screws with it ...

Reviews.Title: In for repair less than 3 months after purchase & Panasonic Customer Service is bad
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic for our bedroom, however, we went to turn it on a few nights ago and got what is referred to by others online as the "red blinking light of death", where the tv shuts itself off after you turn it on and the power light blinks.  We ordered this June 27, and by mid-September it's broken.  We'd have it on a few hours a night, usually weeknights only, so it wasn't really heavy use.The worst part about it is how bad Panasonic's customer service is.  This TV only qualifies for warranty repair where you have to bring it to the repair shop (not in-home).  Ok, fine, it's a cheap one, I understand.  I live in NJ, right across from NYC.  The only way the customer rep could search for repair centers was by zip code.  All of them in or through NYC.  I don't think they have any idea how ridiculous it would be to try to get a 32" TV through the city to get to a repair shop.  It's not just a "hop in the car and take a quick trip down the road" kind of affair, much less getting a TV anywhere on a bus or train.  After an hour later and having to get a supervisor involved (who had the same problem even though I kept repeating I need a place in NJ), the supervisor was able to "find" a service center a few miles away (and a few hours travel-time closer).  It was ridiculous.  You can't search for service centers by city and state?  They even referred me to finding service centers myself online.  Which brings up a page saying to call the help line I was already on for Viera "Concierge" service.  It's a joke.  Then I feel like the ahole at the end of the call by the sound in their voice.We still can't believe we have to go through this crap with a TV less than 3 months old.  I did not try to contact the seller, because the return period is up and it's really not their fault--the TV worked great up until it died.  And go figure, we have a bigger Panasonic Viera in our living room that's been going strong for 3 years now.  Bad luck I guess.  I just wish Panasonic's customer service made me feel like they cared at all about their customers.  Buyer beware about that aspect of this TV.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend
Reviews.Author: M. Muselli "MGM"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as an Anniversary present to my sister & her husband. It arrived super fast and in perfect condition.It is a beautiful TV, sleek and very light. And it has an amazing picture quality. In seconds we had it connected and programing it was a cinch.Best of all I received all of this quality for an incredibly low price.I love it so much I am going to purchase another one for myself.I think Amazon is the BEST and will always check here before purchasing elsewhere.MGMBrooklyn, NY

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 32" HD TV
Reviews.Author: Brett Meeker
Reviews.Content: This product arrived on time and in perfect shape. The price was the lowest I found (lower than the big box stores), and there was no tax or shipping charged. A really good deal through Amazon. The TV was extremely easy to hook up (basically just plug it in) The screen image is clear, and definitely better than similarly priced 32" HD TVs. An altogether positive purchase.

Reviews.Title: This is one fine LCD HDTV!!
Reviews.Author: Richard E.
Reviews.Content: We've been actively looking for replacement to our old TV for a year.  Carefully reading reviews, our interest turned to Panasonic, already knowing a friend who has happily owned one of their 42" models for 2 years.  When the price dropped to below $300 through Amazon for the Panasonic VIERA TCL32, our interest heightened.  Good customer reviews on Amazon and elsewhere, so we bought it a month ago.  Picture is great in every way; I turned the sound EQ up on the "crisp" side, which I like, and the picture is first class.  Easy to use menu, very easy to use remote, and I play my FLIP camera through it.  This is GOOD!

Reviews.Title: bang for your $ buck $
Reviews.Author: william wolf
Reviews.Content: The package arrived in good condition via UPS Ground. I connected it to my computer and dvd player in just a few minutes. The result, instant happiness. this tv is sleek, light and most of all delivers a clear picture with more viewing options up its sleeve. Don't wait, don't believe me, see for yourself and get it while they last. Panasonic TC-L32C3 is a one good looking tv! I approve this message ;)

Reviews.Title: One of the best LCDs for entry level price buyers
Reviews.Author: Charles Brian Foster
Reviews.Content: This is my third LCD TV and the second one I purchased in just a few days time.My first TV had been a $800  from about five years ago when 32" went for that price.  It finally started messing up on me so I looked for something new.  My first TV had been a lower tier brand but a higher end model for that company.  It performed very well and I was sad to see it go.So fast forward to 2012.  The 32" TVs can be found for much less and I thought that there would be an increase in quality just from a technological stand point.  I thought I would save myself a little money a go with a lower tier brand again.Well I was very wrong about that.  I picked up a store's house brand 32" LED TV that seemed to look decent in the store.  I had all the features I needed and then some.  When I got it home, it was a whole different story.  The picture was pretty bad as far as colors go.  It required constant menu adjustments for almost every single show that I watched.  That's unacceptable!Most of these TVs look good with HD source. That is their selling point after all.  However many of us still watch a large amount of SD sources.  We have tons of DVDs, broadcast TV, older videogame systems, and such.  Finding an HD TV that can give acceptable SD performance can be a bit of a pain.  That said, standard definition was an absolute terror on this TV.  Images were splotchy and blurred.  Text was jagged and unreadable.Enough was enough.  I returned it the store and traded up for this Panasonic TV.  What a difference a brand makes!  I paid $50 more for this TV than the house brand.  So let me just go ahead and get this out of the way... "Don't buy the house brand!  Stick with the top tier brands!"This TV has been a joy.  I turned it on and was immediately welcomed with rich color, accurate blacks and wonderful contrast.  Even the low energy mode, which is what I use the most, looks pretty great.  Standard definition, the real barometer for me, is also excellent.  Everything is pleasantly clear.  Text is legible and there are no jagged lines to worry about.I already knew that HD performance should be great.  It was good on all the TVs I have tried.  The Panasonic did not disappoint.  I have couple it with a Blu Ray player and Xbox 360, both connected by HDMI.  The picture looks outstanding with these sources.  There are countless ways to modify the picture, but I find that I don't have to make too many changes.  Other TVs made me have to tinker with the picture settings quite often.  I think it's a compliment to this TV that I didn't have to make too many adjustments.Now there is of course a widely held belief that you need a professional to come set up or "calibrate" your TV for you.  They are supposed to be able to give you the best picture your TV can provide.  Well that's fine and well for those who can afford it.  Most of us are already done after what we had to fork over for our TV.  The thought of adding another hundred dollars or so to have someone adjust the settings can be a little off putting.  I don't plan on doing it.  The fact that I have been happy with this TV without making too many changes means that I expect to remain fully satisfied like I am now.I really have no complaints about the TV.  I can be found on sale for under $300 frequently.  It's a good buy.  Everything I put on it looks good.  Video games give me no noticeable lag.  It has a sleek and well made look to it.Let me add that people should stop expecting any kind of fantastic sound from these slim TVs.  My first gen HDTV had front mounted speakers but was considerable deeper than TVs of today.  It had the best sound of any I've owned.  This TV sounds good enough, but most people would want to run the TV through a surround sound system or at least a stereo setup to get a good sound.  That goes for any of these slim TVs.  People make countless complaints about that one factor, even giving the TV a bad overall review even if the picture was great.I'm just putting that out there so people will know what to expect these days.For my money I have found that staying with LCD is the best bet.  LED TVs seem to look worse than LCD until you go up to a higher cost range.  Plasma TVs are still looked upon as being the best slim format TVs that you can buy.  I would have gone that route if I could afford it.  I couldn't afford it, so I stuck with LCD.  As far as the 60HZ refresh rate goes, I don't have much problem with it.  Even my first HDTV didn't give me too much trouble.  I have never had any prolbems when watching fast moving images.  For some reason it's only when a camera does a rapid pan that I get the harsh artifacts of a 60HZ response.  Still the artifacts are brief and this mostly happens only when watching something live like a football game.  Movies and videogames give me little to no problems in this area.I should also mention that I still subscribe to standard definition cable but I get a lot of free over the air HD channels on this TV and they look great.  One of the house brand TVs I tried, couldn't even find the over the air channels.  I'm very happy with this TV and I hope this review has been helpful.PS: Why 4 stars out of a possible 5?  I believe there is no "perfect" item.  This is more than good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: Impressive for the money
Reviews.Author: Charles Miller "objective clarity"
Reviews.Content: I was (correctly) guided by the previous reviews to purchase this set and am more than satisfied. The ultimate decision was based upon on the fact (at the time of this writing), there was only one 3-star review and none lower. Oft times, an overall high rating becomes questionable when there are a handful of 1-star comments, indicating there are potentially one or more fatal flaws not noticed by everyone. Not so here. This set appears to have no deal-breaker problems.While this is not the best 32" television out there, for the money, it cannot be beat. Keep in mind this is a 720p set versus 1080p, however, the quality of the picture is very impressive and it is bigger bang for the buck compared to expensive models. While not as good as a 1080p set, those cost nearly double and are only slightly better than this. Please note, the features are pretty basic, but there is still a lot of TV here. Set-up takes only minutes, adjustments are simple and effective, the sound is not remarkable but is acceptable, and picture is simply magnificent for 720p... far, far better than expected... clean, sharp and bright. To acheive this, the backlighting and brightness may need to be manually adjusted, but only takes only seconds. If you are on a budget or just want a good quality 2nd HDTV, this is highly recommended for the purpose.

Reviews.Title: Big bang, little buck
Reviews.Author: C. A. Howson
Reviews.Content: This is one fantastic TV for the money. We got this for our new kitchen and it has performed wonderfully since the moment the cable got hooked up.Highly recommend it. A note of bias - we have a 50-inch Viera plasma in the basement and love it, so we weren't exactly surprised at the quality of this set. But for as little as we paid, we can't say enough about the quality.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier. Good for gaming. Good for tv.
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: I am a sophomore in college and was looking for a tv for my dorm room that I could game on as well as watch movies, tv, etc... For 300 dollars this tv couldn't be better. Picture is awesome (especially with HDMI cord on PS3) and if you play COD you will still destroy noobs. There is no lag or anything. We mainly play FIFA and the picture is outstanding. Sound is pretty good for speakers in the tv as well. Set up is easy. At 32 inches, the size is perfect for my dorm room. With my student 2-day free shipping account I ordered the TV on Monday and it arrived on Wednesday at no charge.  I could not be happier with the service or the quality of the TV.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Susan Nash
Reviews.Content: We ordered this set on 8/25 and it arrived on 8/27 (a Saturday delivery no less!).  Took it out of the box and had it set up in less than 10 minutes.  After turning it on, the television's initial on-screen set up was easy to follow and really took very little time.The only reason that I marked the picture quality at a 4 is because it appears a little on the dark side for my old eyes.  Adjusting the back lighting helped a bit.  Color is excellent.  Sound is very good.  This is such an improvement over the Vizio we had.  I have always liked Panasonic and am hoping that the old quality is still there.Given the bad experience we had with the Vizio, I did purchase the 4-year insurance agreement that was on the same page...I'm just not taking any chances on this one.  That was a very easy setup process to go through as well.  I hope to never need it.

Reviews.Title: Another Great Panasonic
Reviews.Author: J. McGovern "BoredAgain"
Reviews.Content: I'm not necessarily brand loyal when it comes to TV's but I do love my 46 inch Panasonic plasma so it was only natural to look at Panasonic again when I needed a 32 inch for my bedroom.  When researching this time around I focused mainly on price as I didn't want to spend too much for a TV that will only get use a few nights a week and this one fit the bill based on price.  I then researched features, 720p vs 1080p, contrast, etc, and this one also had what I was looking for.  Once again, price was the most important part of this purchase but I also didn't feel like I was missing any important features.  If you want a great TV in this price range, and know that 1080p and a billion ports isn't that important for a TV this size, then I suggest this TV.One more thing I want to touch on is the sound quality because a lot of fine TV's get bad reviews based on speakers alone; you don't have to worry with this TV.  The speakers sound great and a lot better than a lot of TV's I've listened to, based on the space the TV is in.  So if you don't have high expectations of booming audio that fills a large space, these speakers will work great and do work great in smaller rooms.  If you are disappointed or want more, look at getting a sound bar to go with it.I believe Panasonic is a great brand and I'm glad that I can trust buying from them again and again.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic pleasure
Reviews.Author: Ronald B. Greenspan
Reviews.Content: This is an easy tv to hook up and start using quickly. It has a fairly straightforward owner/user's manual. I had trouble getting the color balance right until I delved into the manual, found the right setting for my purposes and let the tv decide to adjust itself to the lighting. For those of us who are used to power wasting instant on, you're going to have to wait 5 or 6 seconds from the time you hit the on button until you see a picture. It's a small price to pay for the energy costs I'll save. This is a lot of good tv for the money.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: I-Like-Movies
Reviews.Content: I paid just under $290 with employee discount. The video quality is really very nice, especially when the viewing distance is less than eight feet. I am no audiophile, but it sounds very nice as well even at very high decibel.Personally I can hardly tell the difference between the HDMI cable and the composite cable when watching from a distance, but people say it does make it better.I cancelled my cable (over $60/month for extended basic), and that will more than completely cover this TV, the HDMI cable (around $5), the LG blue ray player with wireless Internet capability (about $170), and the Netflix stream-only subscription for one year (a little under $108).

Reviews.Title: Challenge: Any Better TV for $300?
Reviews.Author: malikona
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not a TV or HD video buff, but I do have pretty high standards for resolution, color accuracy, etc. I only had about $300 budgeted for a new TV, and I knew 32" was the size I was looking for. I researched the options pretty thoroughly, and I was most influenced by one person who was a bulk buyer of TVs for installation in hospitals and nursing homes. He has, he said, seen pretty much every 32" in this price range, and he thought this one was far-and-away the best. So I had Amazon ship me one overnight for just a hair over $300.Physically the set is simple, attractive, and unassuming. Another family member just bought the Sony Bravia KDL-32BX310, a very similarly-spec'd set (without IPS however), which has a very slim and good-looking profile, trimmed in white on the back. While the TC-L32C3 is almost identical from the front, it is probably twice as thick and not very attractive from the back (ventilation grating, etc.). This is irrelevant to me, but I thought it was an interesting difference. (Maybe the IPS requires the box to be thicker?)As for picture quality, I really can't imagine how an image could look sharper. If the 1080p version of this set (the U, E, & D series) is higher resolution, I doubt my eyes could discern it. The image is pixel-perfect to my eyes, with excellent viewing angles and a wide variety of customization options (with configurable presets). Audio quality, and especially volume, is also very good. I am not a TV-watcher (movies and Apple TV/iTunes streaming only, really) but I find myself making excuses to watch more things just so I can look at this display.I personally don't like the super high-res, high frame rate style of video (that I call "Soap Opera Video") that you see sometimes on commercials and such. I prefer cinema-style video, if you know what I mean. So maybe that biases me against 1080p, 120Hz displays etc., but as far as I'm concerned paying more (often WAY more) for video that looks marginally better, at most - or just different, at least - doesn't make much sense. If there's a better TV out there for $300, I'd love to see it.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture & Sound. Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: TomT
Reviews.Content: Can't speak for the longevity, but for just about Three Hundred, I don't see how you can go wrong.Perfect TV for a Bedroom, Den or Small Living Room.Been watching some movies from Netflix from a Sony Blu-ray player,and am just thrilled with both Picture & Sound levels.Especially surprised by the good black levels.I set the Picture on the Standard setting, and that looks just fine.For me, the two HDMI are plenty.If there is a "Blinking Red Light" problem, an extended warranty shouldhelp with that. And since the TV price is so low, that shouldbe very reasonable too.But I will say I had 50" Panny plasma for two years with no issues,(which I sold to a friend) and I know it's still going strong.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Durable
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Picture good for 720p. Speakers good. Remote and sleep function poor. I sill recommend Panasonic for it's good quality and durability. Could not beat price at Amazon

Reviews.Title: better TV
Reviews.Author: Johnny M Harper
Reviews.Content: We tried the Vizio 26 inch and had to send it back after 3 weeks of trying to adjust the color, etc. The Panasonic 26 inch we ordered required no adjustments and has performed flawlessly. So when we wanted to order a 32 inch for my mother on mother's day, the Panasonic 32 inch is what we ordered. Again, no problems and she is a very happy 94 year old mother. Amazon was great in their delivery, return, etc. Very happy with this TV. jh

Reviews.Title: very awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Rey
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV for my room to play with my PS3 and boy was I glad I bought it. I didn't know what to expect after spending a week looking for one and this one caught my eye and the positive reviews made my decision, and picture is perfect and no lagging issues with games so far, and the sound quality is good for me. It was really worth the money. I'll update my review when I have more time with it. Awesome TV.Mediabridge Ultra Series - High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet - (6 Feet) - Category 2 Certified - Supports 3D & Audio Return Channel [Latest HDMI Version Available] and this is an HDMI cable that I bought from here for the TV, It's really good for the price.

Reviews.Title: TV Color
Reviews.Author: lizard
Reviews.Content: Everything about the product was what I expected but the color on the TV is off. I have adjusted the settings and its no use. The color pink shows up blue and the entire screen has a green tinge.

Reviews.Title: Superb image quality and energy efficiency
Reviews.Author: VM
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent television with fantastic picture quality.  We bought this Panasonic to replace our old Sony CRT, and we couldn't be more happy with it.  32" is a good size if you live in a smaller apartment, like we do, and don't need a gigantic HDTV that takes up one whole wall of your living room.  It's only 720p, but for a small-to-medium TV like this, 1080p would be overkill.  If we'd bought a 1080p TV I doubt we'd notice the higher resolution.Major advantages for this TV are the light weight (it can be easily moved by one person), energy efficiency, image quality, and sound quality.  It's Energy Star rated, and the federal Energy Guide sticker that came with our TV estimated its yearly energy cost at only $9 even if it was used 5 hours every day for a year.  Most comparable models range from $11 to $25 per year in energy costs, so this is an extremely efficient TV (good for the environment and your electric bill).  The image quality is what makes this TV really stand out.  It has good color reproduction, very dark blacks, and an extremely wide range of viewing angles.  It uses IPS technology (the type of LCD panel found in the iPad and iPhone 4), which results in better colors and much better viewing angles than TVs that use older, cheaper TFT technology.  The sound quality is also surprisingly good.  In general, the speakers that come included with TVs are very poor quality.  We were somewhat surprised to find that the speakers on this Panasonic work quite well -- better than the speakers on some expensive 50" and 60" TVs that I've seen.  We had a set of external speakers that we were planning to connect, but ended up sticking with the included speakers because we were perfectly satisfied with them.One more thing that we liked about this TV is that it has a nice, simple, understated black exterior -- no silly, distracting "Touch of Color" strip like the Samsung LN32D450 that we also considered.  The emphasis is all on the actual display.

Reviews.Title: Yes, it is an IPS Panel (Fantastic!)
Reviews.Author: James E. Ranshaw
Reviews.Content: The product description was a bit confusing, first saying it was an IPS panel, and then amazon's chart says its just LCD. It is in fact an IPS panel, which means the colors are consistent at all viewing angles, and they look great. I have another 42" Panasonic with IPS, and it looks just as good.My only complaint was the same as another reviewer, and that is this TV does not fit well with low profile wall mounts. The connectors in back point to the rear, instead of downward, so you need about 2" at least to get it to fit without interference. My wall mount was probably 1/2", so I had to add spacers between the wall and the mount. Also, the four holes on the rear of the TV were inconsistently deep.. meaning the top two work fine with my previous screws, but the lower two holes were shallower and the screw required either trimming or a spacer (I used a spacer). So, it wasn't the 2 minute job I expected when swapping out this TV with my old Vizio that burnt out, but it worked eventually. If you have a wall mount that is a bit off the wall, there shouldnt be an issue.TV is awesome though. I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: OK for price, disappointing picture
Reviews.Author: Biotexts2
Reviews.Content: We ordered this TV on the basis of the glowing Amazon reviews.  I must say I am disappointed at the picture quality.  The unit arrived promptly, was well packed, and easy to set up.  It took several minutes for it to find all our digital and analog channels.  The remote worked well and the adjustment functions were logical and easy.  First of all, I noticed that this was not a thin screen like the LCD units I had seen in the local stores.  This set is as thick as a plasma, at about 3.5 inches.  Second, it is heavy at over 20 pounds, and probably not something to hang unless you purchase a bracket that would hold this unit.  Our biggest problem was the picture.  It was very dark with standard settings, and not sharp.  We have cable and expected a picture at least equal to the old-fashioned tube set this unit replaces.  Not to be.  We have jacked up brightness and backlighting to 90% and played with color and tint.  To me the picture is still dark and disappointing.  We will continue to fiddle with this but I was expecting a great picture right out of the box.  Maybe the LCD does save on power, but like most people we are most interested in a good picture.  Disappointed.  Should have kept looking or tried to find one in the store to see the image.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price......better picture quality costs more.....
Reviews.Author: WoodyWW
Reviews.Content: For 3 hundred$$, as of late 2011, I guess this is a bargain, that's why I ordered it. I made an assumption tho, that it would have at least as high a picture quality as my two 4-5 y.o. Toshiba LCD 720p TV's. But I found the picture quality on this to be noticeably worse (with the same DVR, cable company, & DVD player). I also thought the cabinet "looked" cheap, & the bright red "on" light to be very distracting, like the computer in "2001".Maybe--I should've read between the lines of the user reviews more. For a kid's room, or 2nd bedroom, anyplace where your budget is really $300, this is a great deal, & maybe I expected too much. YMMV, of course.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: A. Mizicko
Reviews.Content: I am on TDY in another city, and bought this as an inexpensive TV solution to play PS3 and watch movies on Netflix.  The price was right, and although only 720p resolution, the picture is fine.  Sound isn't bad either, for regular old TV speakers.  Overall, I am very happy with this purchase, and would recommend for anyone who wants an inexpensive monitor, especially if you are not intending to use a separate receiver for audio.

Reviews.Title: Great Clear Picture
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic TV has a Very sharp picture. The sound is very good. And, it's easy to make a cable connection.

Reviews.Title: Is less more?
Reviews.Author: That Guy With This Tv
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Viera C3 is an amazing product. The picture is crisp, and clear. Sound quality is solid and full of the highs, lows, and mids. It is easy to use and easy to setup. The only issue I can see people having is the amount of ports on the back of the tv. It has 2 HDMI's, 1 VGA, 1 COMPONANT (GRBRY), AND 1 COMPOSITE. I do not find an issue with it. I have a Cable Box, Mac, Xbox 360, Nintendo 64, Atari 2600, and an NES. If its really a big issue then purchase an external composite/componant that holds 1 componant, and 2 composite. So, you will gain 1 extra componant, and and extra composite. Otherwise the tv itself is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Superb
Reviews.Author: Sam Sosa
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever HDTV and all the research and wait has paid off because this is one hell of a TV! It's mainly for gaming on PS3 and it is light years ahead of SDTV. Everything now is crystal clear and elegant, even on 720p. I have not noticed any lag at all while playing.The setup is easy to hook and install, although the 4 holes are a little too deep for the screws and can take an extra minute or two to fit them.Also much lighter to carry than my old SDTV which was like 100 lbs. The energy saving feature is another nice addition. All in all I am happy so far, Panasonic Vierra is perfect for a bedroom. Check out my pics...

Reviews.Title: Panasonic does it right.
Reviews.Author: Jockdoc
Reviews.Content: This is my second Viera. Ther first one is a 58 inch plasma. I love this brand, especially the Viera Link interface. It allows me to use the tv as a multimedia center, linking most of the other AV items in the house. Great picture, good sound, great options. All for 300 bucks. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: impressive
Reviews.Author: hamed
Reviews.Content: seriously for this price i dont think you get a better picture, Panasonic always talks about how good their picture is and ... yes its really good. i use to alot with my laptop via HDMI and im very surprised on how it looks better on tv that on my computer screen. you def can NOT go wrong with this Tv as long as the screen size isnt too small for you . i was used to watching on a panasonic 50" plasma at my house now i live in an apartment and at first i thought the tv was a bit small but i have gotten used to it for sure

Reviews.Title: Good LCD TV
Reviews.Author: D. Eddlemon
Reviews.Content: For this price it's a good quality TV. It has a good picture. The only thing that disappointed me was the lack of audio outputs. I wanted to use some old powered PC speakers, but can't do it too well since there is no headphone jack nor RCA audio outputs. I would have to buy some converter box and use the optical output of the TV to use my PC speakers. I have to buy the right converter to get HD audio with Dolby to play through these speakers. To get the good Dolby sound I would have to buy an AV receiver and speakers for 5.1 or 7.1 Dolby. Oh well, I may just live with the TV speakers since this TV is not used that much.

Reviews.Title: A great buy in TV
Reviews.Author: Dominick J. Paolillo
Reviews.Content: We replaced an old 25" CRT TV with this 32" Viera.  That was all we had room for! A smaller TV just would not have the features available at the 32" level, and a larger TV would not fit on the table top we had available.  We selected the Viera because its sound system is superior to that of other TVs in the 32" class.  And the picture is excellent, and it can be adjusted so many ways (including aspect ratio) that anyone can have it the way they want.  The inputs and outputs solved many of our problems.  For example, I am hard of hearing and my wife is not.  But the use of a digital optical audio cable allows me to channel TV sound into my hi-fi amplifier for custom treatment and output to my earphones.  Really neat!  And now our TV takes advantage of component video for best quality from our DVD player.  Yet this sophisticated TV plugged right in to our cable connection and gave us superior perfomance right out of the box.  The instruction manual is informative and easy to understand.  All electronic purchases should end this well!

Reviews.Title: Good TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: ntares
Reviews.Content: For the low $300 range, this is a great value. I ordered this TV after a 32" Westinghouse went bad on me after only a couple weeks! I've learned my lesson and will stick with Panasonic and the more reputable brands in the future. I've seen a few reviews mention the audio. Nobody should be expecting bass from a flat panel, but both vocals and music sound warm and full compared to other units. The viewing angle is very wide and the black levels are decent for a non-LED. My only complaint would be that the input connectors go straight out the back and could cause clearance issues when wall-mounting. That's easily solvable by getting some right-angle connectors, and a non-factor if you're just using the stand like me.

Reviews.Title: Buy it at only $329 !!! It is a BARGAIN !!!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Charles A. Kirkland
Reviews.Content: Got the television quickly through the mail. Beautiful picture and well packed for shipping. Great price at $329.00. It is a bargain compared to retail store prices too.Any 32" or smaller television has no in home repair warranty. You have to take it in to a authorized dealer for warranty work or mail it to dealer. I would go with a 37" or larger television just for the in home service warranty.Panasonic has the best picture after comparing major brands. Stay away from cheap no name brands. They are throw away products. Panasonic will be around for a long time and they have many authorized dealers for future service needs. Safe choice.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: Chunk~n~Fatboy
Reviews.Content: This tv has a great picture also a hidden feature i was unaware of until a few days ago is that i can use this tv's remote to control my slim ps3 this was a welcome feature as i did not want to have to purchase another remote for the price and feature set you will be hard pressed to find any thing better!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: GGmax9
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our bedroom to use as an alarm, we LOVE it. It comes on every morning at the set time and stays on for an hour, then shuts off, PERFECT, just what we wanted!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Only Panasonic
Reviews.Author: MrFoobar2U
Reviews.Content: First:If a screen is less 50", then your eye can't tell the difference between 720p and 1080p.The only way to take advantage of 1080p is through Blue Ray.. 1080p eats up too much bandwidth for broadcasters to use.That being said, I bought this unit.Second: up until I bought this unit, I had 1 rule of thumb when buying electronics: Buy Panasonic (I still have a working 'digital' clock from 1975).Third:Picture is amazing, ease of setup, hooked up to Fios.. so second point still stands. Always buy Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful and economical
Reviews.Author: Jeff C. "Jeff C"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my neighbor who needed som help selecting a display.  The amount of bad info out there is amazing.  For example, people are being told 720 isn't HD or isn't good enough!  This is a 32" display.  Resolution is finite to your eye.  You will save money and never know the difference on a 32" display with a native 720 panel.This has great color out of the box, is easy to adjust to a more realistic picture, and has acceptable sound for a flat panel display.  There are plenty of connections.  And I love the simple design of panasonic remotes.I will purchase another one of these for myself soon.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Brian A. Culliver
Reviews.Content: We found the quality of the picture very good.  After a simple installation, all of the functions were readily available.  The TV was mounted on the wall, with help.  The TV volume is adequate most of the time, but some programs have been hard to hear, even with the volume turned up.  I may look into options that can help to increase the sound volume.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive!
Reviews.Author: M. Blumberg "MJayBee"
Reviews.Content: I set out to buy an inexpensive 32" LCD TV. After visiting a big box store which carried several brands, I quickly narrowed the choices to 2 sets, $100 apart. Bought the Panasonic set and have been even more impressed with the quality of the picture. So far I am thrilled with my choice. Quite frankly, the picture is better than the more expensive set.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Michael Doherty
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this tv. Very crisp and clear picture. My only problem with it is that the makes a buzzing noise when very low tones play through the speakers. Simply hooked it up to a 5.1 surround sound system and no more buzzing.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for low $300's
Reviews.Author: Catherine Cuthbert
Reviews.Content: This is our second 32" LCD TV. The other is a Sony - it was more expensive, the picture is better, and it has more inputs. However, we did not want to spend more than $350 and so, after seeing this TV in person at a store, we pulled the trigger. I had to do a LOT of manual manipulation of color, brightness, etc. to get it where I wanted it, but after 45 minutes or so we have a picture we like. It's fine - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Mom's new TV
Reviews.Author: ADS
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Panasonic Viera TC-L32CE for my Mother for x-mas to replace an older analgue set. She is delighted with it. Deliverey was very quick. Set is well made , easy to set up and program. Very good picture, even on an angle.  I purchased this set due to its size ( It fit where I needed it to go) and it's great satisfaction rating.  Very nice TV and certainly worth looking at this line.

Reviews.Title: Good TV but a problem
Reviews.Author: Next1Eric
Reviews.Content: I started using this TV on Nov. 3 of 2011 and it broke down on January 14 of 2012 so it broke down in less then 75 days which is a big disappointment for me from Panasonic. Hope it don't break down that fast again after it gets fixed up and if it does no more Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Does not Disappoint!
Reviews.Author: FitForFood
Reviews.Content: For $300, this TV is hard to beat! I have a 52" Sharp LED 1080p in my living room so I thought I'd be downgrading by getting a 720p TV for my bedroom... read the reviews and thought I'd give this TV a shot. Boy was I surprised! The image is as clear as my 1080p led TV and surprisingly the sound is better (although I eventually hooked it up to my 5.1 surround sound system using the optical output).I only needed 2 HDMI ports, so this TV worked out perfectly for me. I also connected my computer to the VGA input with no problems. I used the full motion Cheetah mount (also purchased on Amazon) which supports the 19 lb TV perfectly!All in all, this TV delivers and for $300 - I couldn't really ask for anything more! Amazon was also awesome with honoring their price guarantee. I had purchased the TV 2 weeks back at $320 and a week later the price dropped to $300 and they refunded me the 20 without question.Another awesome purchase - thanks Amazon/Panasonic!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in September as it was time for an upgrade.  It is a great TV with a clear picture, easy set up, and good sound quality.  I have not needed to add external speakers as is necessary on many TVs these days.  The remote is easy to use and the hook ups are adequate for my purposes.  We often use the HDMI inputs to hook my laptop to the TV to watch NETFLIX and ESPN3.  These connections are easy and the picture quality is unchanged.  We are using this TV in a smallish living room. Because of the excellent picture, 32 inches is enough.  I've had this TV for 4 months and no complaints or problems so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Entry LCD HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Roger L. Jones Jr. "Roger J"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Panasonic VIERA TC-L32C3 for my daughter, as she needed a flat screen TV for her first apartment.  First off, shipping from Electronic Express on the item was very quick.  Box arrived safely via UPS.  Second, it was a snap to set up, program and connect to a Panasonic DMP-BDT210 Blu-ray player we also purchased from Amazon.com.I am a self-confessed audio/video nut with a high-end home theater set up, so I'm not easily impressed.  After adjusting the settings appropriately, this 32" LCD has a beautiful picture.  It is one of the better entry level 720p LCD's I have seen.So, if you need a smaller flat screen for your bedroom or you have a small room with a close viewing distance (7' or less)the TC-L32C3 is just the ticket.  It's aa best buy IMHO.

Reviews.Title: this TV looks great
Reviews.Author: chad
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV expert but for the price the TV looks awesome. We did have to adjust the lighting from standard to cinema because it was to dark but it wasnt a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice!
Reviews.Author: K. J. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv for my front room. . It was easy to set up, I put on the base and plugged in my Comcast dvr and was up and running in about 15 minutes.  I  did have to adjust the picture from the factory setting, but thats  a personal preference.  This is a nice tv for the price, very happy with it.  amazon shipping was great, got the tv the day after I ordered it.  Luckily I was home for the delivery, UPS needs a signature, so keep that in mind when ordering.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: Very good product, nice sound, picture color, clarity, and contrast. No complaints. Only have it for a month, so don't know about the durability yet.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Christoph J
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon Warehouse Deals.  This was the first Panasonic TV I have ever owned and I have to say it was a great investment.  Not only was it a bit cheaper, the "like-new" condition was totally on point as the TV looks and functions brand-spanking new.  I love the IPS display, great viewing angles.  I do not subscribe to paid TV and I have to say the OTA HD channels I get are superb.  Same thing goes with Netflix and Hulu through the PS3.  PS3 games also look fantastic.  Speaking of the PS3, Viera Link is awesome with it.  No need to buy an additional receiver to use a remote on your PS3.  Mine was picked up automatically, no programming whatsoever.  And let me tell you, it's as convenient and convenient gets.  All the colors are on point and everything looks as good as my old TV as far as picture.  Of course this was after I adjusted my settings, which is something that comes with purchasing a new TV.  I don't really have an opinion on sound as I have it hooked to my home theater.My last TV was a 50" Samsung 1080p that I had to sell before moving across country and to my surprise, this replacement has made me nothing short of happy even though it's definitely smaller in size and resolution.  This was for sure a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Ordered this tv for the bedroom after researching a ton... I have to agree with most of the other reviewers; the picture looks awesome, the sound is fantastic - very clear with good bass. Great price with free shipping. Arrived in 3 days. Would definitely recommend for the bedroom or small living room.

Reviews.Author: Outrun1986
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV and a good value, you really can't go wrong with it. I am very pleased with this TV and it fits perfectly into my bedroom.  This is an ideal TV for a bedroom.  The remote sensor issues are valid, if you tighten the screws too much on the back when putting the TV together you will interfere with the sensor and it will not work.  When I was putting the TV together I could see the sensor was directly under the screws that go into the base, unless you are doing some type of wall mount you need to look out for this.  You also need to put the TV on something with an edge when setting it up so you can screw in the base, so you can't put down a soft cloth on the floor and do it that way cause it won't work.  My remote sensor works with no problem though.  I wish it had more component inputs as it only has one and I would like to use more than one, but finding a TV with more than one would be a hassle and it would cost a lot more money.  The TV was very easy to set up itself.  I think the TV is plenty thin, I can lift it myself and the instruction manual seemed to spell out every step of the setup procedure right down to how to put the batteries into the remote.  The initial setup for the TV was also very easy, it doesn't take long at all to set up after you connect all your stuff and the TV starts the initial setup itself immediately after first plugging it in.

Reviews.Author: lailari72
Reviews.Content: I had done so much research into other tv's on here, including the two 32' inch Samsungs and after seeing them in the store I decided against them. The reason was, they had such a wobbly base and living in earthquake country, a wobbly base is not such a good idea. This Panasonic has a strong sturdy base and putting the tv together was very easy, no need for any tech people to hook it up. The picture is gorgeous, and the sound for the streaming-netflix/tv is very good, when the DVD is on it could be a little better, but hey I'm not complaining.All in all, it's an excellent tv.

Reviews.Title: A buy!
Reviews.Author: Larry Fox

All of us rave about the set: Easy to set-up.  Top quality picture--I cannot see the difference between this 720 and my 65" 1080 in terms of picture.  Sound is reasonably good for an inexpensive set.  In a short phrase: Pansonic delivers!

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV for the price
Reviews.Author: David A. Wright "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 3 weeks. The picture and sound are really good sharp and clear at a great Amazon price. I had Dish Network set it up for me in my bedroom. No problems with the unit, so far(knock on wood.) I've waited a long time to upgrade to HD and I'm happy with my purchase. Thanks Amzon!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: MAG

Reviews.Title: Great 32" LCD TV

Reviews.Title: Pleasent View

Reviews.Title: Superb Low Priced TV
Reviews.Author: tedg13
Reviews.Content: This is an extraordinary good TV for the price.  In fact, I think it is of better quality than a Samsung which I also own.  Picture Quality is exceptional and so is the sound which is problematic for the Samsung products.  At less than $300...This is a GREAT BUY!

Everything about the TV is good except I did not realize there is NO audio out for external speakers apart from home theater systems. For the hard of hearing this is an inconvenience.

Reviews.Content: This is a piece of junk! I bought this in January 2012 and now stopped working all of a sudden. It went off while watching a movie and now it does not turn on again. I never thought this would happen with Panasonic brand. Dont recommend it at all!!

Reviews.Author: Rahabib
Reviews.Content: I have set up a number of TVs, and as far as picture quality goes, this is the best TV ever.  Its even better than my Plasma Panasonic ST50 (which is also good).  Its easy to tweak to get great quality.  great blacks, great whites (and they look white!), great color all around.  Very little blur,  Very (almost none) little uniformity issues or edge bleeding.I was worried about not having 1080p but honestly on a set this size at 6' away, you could probably tell very little difference.  I play games on it (PS3) watch TV and blu-ray movies on it, all great.

Reviews.Author: rockytop
Reviews.Content: Small but nice for our guests.  Good picture and sound.  Nice size for the guest room.  Our guests enjoy this.

Reviews.Content: The TV died (wouldn't power on) 6 months after purchase. I got it repaired under Panasonic warranty. The Panasonic authorized repair shop that Panasonic sent me to was terrible. The repair took over a month (to "reseat the circuit board") and then they didn't call me for an additional month and half to let me know it was ready.
