Reviews.Author: David Graham "CrackerMan"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic has done it again!  I cannot imagine getting a better HDTV for $300.  It has a great picture and sound but that's no surprise because Panasonic makes great products.  This one is no exception and for the price, can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Excellent mid-range choice, requires heavy tweaking
Reviews.Author: Christopher Engel
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have already said enough about the set, so I'm going to add something original about how this particular TV, if heavily tweaked in its settings menu, can look much, much better than what would normally be logical.First, you'll want to use a different setup for either SDTV or HDTV. SDTV settings are OK at basic levels, with contrast and backlight as high as you can stand, which will probably be the maximum. Everything else can remain at 50, and any tweaking for SD picture will be minimal.For HDTV, none of the default presets are anywhere near what they should be. Here's a rundown of the crucial settings that need tweaking:SAMPLE FILMS TESTED: Transformers 3 (bright colors, heavy detail), Se7en (pitch-black darks, "horror" look), Alien Vs. Predator: Requiem (A film with a notoriously bad picture to begin with, having ultra-heavy darks that make the film practically impossible to see and horrible over-saturation from the source film--an example of how well the TV handles what was originally a bad picture in theaters), No Country For Old Men (variety), and The Shining (older film on Blu-ray).Contrast/Backlight: 100Brightness: Greatly dependent on the source, but has the best quality at zero--for some extra-dark scenes in films, though, this isn't feasible.Sharpness: ZeroColor Temperature: CoolAI Picture: OnEverything else can be set at 50 or normal.All static reducers disabled, as they will have the opposite effect on an HD signal.Brightness and sharpness at *zero*? Yep, that's what ultimately gave me the best picture, and they're both very important changes. Basically, this particular TV gives little room for customization, and the sliders generally do not have a particularly strong impact on the picture. Because all Blu-ray movies are necessarily 1080p, the 720p down-conversion is going to be a serious pain, and everyone should know that. But that's why a larger and much clearer 1080p TV costs so much more. Don't expect the same from both.Having said that, even at zero, the brightness and sharpness placed at zero are not nearly as extreme as a larger 55" Viera using an LED backlight, in which its base settings are actually ideal for most films. The difference in tweaking, though, is huge. With brightness at 50 on this TV, blacks tend to look a little too bright, and of course any higher than that and it looks horribly washed-out. Depending on the film, you might be forced to bring this slider as high as 50. Transformers 3, which is almost always using bright and vibrant colors, looks gorgeous when its deep colors can come out while they're not restricted by the brightness setting. However, certain scenes from AvP and Se7en are nearly pitch-black, completely masking any character's face, which means you can't expect to watch films with that kind of color scheme. But if the film can cooperate with it, a setting of zero provides the clearest picture while maintaining key bright areas. This can probably be chalked up to the AI Picture setting, which boosts bright areas of the screen so as to make them stand up to the setting and maintain an absolutely gorgeous picture, especially for a down-conversion. You can *almost* get the "wow" factor this way as you would a very large LED TV. In fact, you probably would be able to get that if smaller TVs such as this one supported motion enhancing. Unfortunately, this one, at 32", definitely does not qualify for that selling point.The sharpness is very odd on this television in that it seems to be far too jagged even at 50. It's so bad, in fact, that a setting of zero provides what looks like a normal "50" setting on most other TVs. Even at a dead zero, the picture does not look at all washed-out, blurred, or in any way hindered. It does help significantly with the jagged edges due to the 720p conversion, though. This does not appear to be strongly affected by the source, so it can remain at that setting safely. I have yet to watch a Blu-ray or play a Playstation 3 game in which the sharpness, being at zero, is a bad thing, and only looks worse if it's turned up.Note that it's important on an HD signal to turn off static reducers meant for SD, as they will have the exact opposite effect, increasing static. Unlike larger Panasonic Vieras, there is no "Auto" option that detects when you're watching SD versus HD, meaning this is something you would have to change manually every time you switched from one resolution to the other. But you will notice a significant increase in the level of graininess if these are turned on when an HD picture is being projected, so definitely keep them off for anything other than SD. This includes DVDs being upscaled.The color temperature set at "Cool" instead of the neutral setting removes a lot of the excess red from the screen that is there if you just take it out of the box. "Neutral" is actually too warm for this particular set, so setting it to cool is something you will probably set once and keep it that way. In every film I've tested, "Cool" definitely provides the best color, while anything higher saturates the picture tone with excessive reds.As with all TVs, this TV has its own unique configuration that works only for itself. In this case, drastically changing several picture options actually improves the quality very significantly. However, as I've found out, this does not at all apply to a 55" LED Viera, which requires far higher brightness and sharpness settings to look its best. I tried similar settings on one and in return got an extremely dark and unwatchable picture and a slightly washed image. Part of that is because of 1080p versus 720p and also LCD versus LED backlighting.Finally, just to reiterate the one confusing "feature" here, "Game Mode" does absolutely nothing noticeable on this set, but it's clear that Panasonic included it because it's also included on the Plasma models where it actually serves a purpose of preventing burn-in. The only thing Game Mode does is turn off all the options that would cause burn-in on a plasma set if they were turned on. On anything other than their Plasma sets, though, this setting is useless, and serves no purpose at all. There is no change in the picture as far as I can tell, and despite that the advertising claims that this improves motion, this does not appear to be true, and I noticed no change in fluidity whatsoever. There's really no reason to use this mode on an LCD screen, and is very likely on there because Panasonic didn't want to simply take out a supposed "feature" that existed on its earlier Plasma models, using it as nothing more than a selling point. In reality, though, this setting does nothing at all on this set besides purposelessly disabling a couple of display options.In any case, this is an excellent midrange TV to be used as a spare. You obviously can't expect anything a larger 1080p would do, but for comparable sets, this is very likely one of the best LCD choices there is. Just make sure you have custom settings for both SD and HD sources, as the presets included are all worthless.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: jozz
Reviews.Content: this tv is a good TV it works well, and nice looking .I never had anyproblem. I was not sure if I should buy it at first,but now I am happy I bought it.the picture is great, and the sound also.

Reviews.Title: Best buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Allen Nelson
Reviews.Content: This was a gift and the party that received it was very pleased.  Very easy to set up and operate with an excellent picture and sound quality (although we hooked up her stereo to add to the sound quality).  We put on the movie How to Train Your Dragon and her children were absolutely enthralled.  It's been about six months since I gave it to her and she's had no problems with it at all.  I advised her to play it for 30 days straight (24/7) so that we would find out early if there were any problems to be found.  While a waste of some electricity, the peace of mind after was satisfying.Good TV worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Bxbigpipi
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my daughter on her birthday and it works great! She plays games on it and watches movies on it and she is happy with it and so am I.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: Has a great picture and outstanding sound quality. The remote is simple and easy to use.I use a media streamer on mine and the picture and load times are good.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera TV
Reviews.Author: AnnV
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. So glad that I purchased it.I still have an older Panasonic that will be replaced in the futurewith another Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: I love my Panasonic TV
Reviews.Author: TinaB
Reviews.Content: The days of multiple cables and hookups are gone.  It was something I left to the men of the house but it was so simple for me to set up with bluray and roku!  Great picture and sound is not a problem.Panasonic still gets my business now and in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Ernest L. Barrette
Reviews.Content: Was great right out of the box.  Picture, color,definition were all sharp.Would recommend to anyone.  Price was the best.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV for Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Geenah1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice TV, especially for the price.  I bought it for a friend for her bedroom.  She didn't want anything too big, and this turned out to be the perfect size.  The HD channels are very crisp, and for just wanting to watch TV programs, this TV is just right.  She LOVES it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: lisasarefun
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoy everything about this tv! I live by myself and it fits my tv/movie watching needs perfectly. Also watched a DVD of a movie made in the early 80's and the quality was great. Great picture, great sound.

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: William M. Graves "'tinbender""
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV from amazon late on a Monday and it was delivered on Thurs. I also ordered a wall mount as I was going to use it in my bedroom. From the box to the wall in about 45 minutes. The picture is great, but I was more impressed with the sound as most thin line TVs seem to lack in this area. Good product good price easy setup. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: panasonic lcd tv
Reviews.Author: diddle
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for the bedroom and it works great.good size, good picture and sound. Remote control works flawlessly. I would recommend this tv for anyone looking for a 720p set. I have a panasonic 50" 1080p and cannot see any difference between the paictures.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L32C3 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: William O. Plaster Jr.
Reviews.Content: I suppose it represents the phrase, "You get what you pay for". The TV is adequate, but I am disappointed with the picture quality. Regardless of which setting I use, the picture is slightly grainy and the colors aren't comparable with the other TV's I have (42 and 50 inch Panasonic plasma, and a 32 in. Panasonic LCD). As I stated previously, the TV is adequate considering the price I paid ($299.99) from amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 32" TV
Reviews.Author: W.R. Van Buskirk
Reviews.Content: Ecellent product. Very light weight. Picture is sharper than any I've seen to date.Panasonic is proving itself to be one of the better electronic devices.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for my master bedroom
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a second TV for our master bedroom, and for the price, it's a great addition and works fine. I mounted it up on the wall out of the way, and it has plenty of connections for eveything I needed, and has a good picture. I got everything to work fine using the Comcast remote that runs the cable box that does all the tuning work, which is nice. One remote to run everything in the bedroom and I didn't have to buy a universal remote just for that. Works for me!

Reviews.Title: Was pleasantly surprised....
Reviews.Author: cndublu
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV from Amazon Wharehouse deals. It was listed as very good but I never found anything wrong with it. That was the first big relief. The second was the picture. It was great. I also have a Vizio 720p tv and it is just as good if not better. I did have to go into the "Viera Tools" on the remote and set it to gaming view. This seemed to brighten the picture quite a bit. Overall a great buy for me.....

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased as a replacement in the bedroom.  This TV is a "Best Buy" in Consumer Reports and its performance is actualy higher than its rating (in my opinion).  Lastly, the price is excellent and the size is perfect for the bedroom

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Rules!
Reviews.Author: Budget Buyer 13
Reviews.Content: After looking for a few months for a new T.V., I came across the Panasonic Viera.  I read all reviews off of several sites about the set.  I replaced my 22" Samsung which had amazing color, but the sound sucked.  I had to buy a sound bar to hear it over my window air conditioner.  Even when the air was off I had the sound high.This Viera is way better.  The set is uber easy to put together and set up.  The color is very great and it's so easy to connect my DVD player and Tivo.  I have had no problems with my Viera.  Don't let the negative reviews cloud your judgement, this is a great television that is thin and light weight (it is lighter than my little Samsung).  It's size is perfect too for my 350 SQ FT studio.  If the price is right I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: advantages of the Viera Panasonic tv
Reviews.Author: Jerry M. Keller
Reviews.Content: Jerry Keller writes:Panasonic has greatly improved two problems that most LCD TVs suffer from. 1- All faces and flesh tones seem to be artificially painted on. Panasonic video processors have eliminated this problem by controlling how they process the mid tones in the video signal (Gamma) you will find this tv looks much more natural. All the faces will have depth and shadowing instead as the usual 'painted on " look. 2- Unlike most LCD TVs, you will find that you can view this screen from any angle without the usual problem of washing out the picture as you get further away from viewing it head on..  The only "Con" with this set is the lack of Analog audio output. As is the case with most modern digital tv s. If you use remote headsets to listen to the audio on this set, you will need a converter that allows you to take the" Toslink" digital optical audio output and convert it to old fashioned analog audio (RCA plug connectors) Amazon sells this converter if needed.  You will find that you will be well satisfied with this Panasonic Tv. It has enough input selections both HDMI and Component Video to allow the addition of auxiliary equipment (DVDs, Roxio, xbox etc.)JerryFiiO D3 Digital to Analog Audio Converter - 192kHz/24bit Optical and Coaxial DAC

Reviews.Title: Great second TV
Reviews.Author: Dickm
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 10 year old to watch TV and DVDs, and to play video games.  The setup was a snap.  While it doesn't have a lot of "bells and whistles" it is perfect for our needs, and is very reasonably priced.  The picture is sharp, and the sound is good, both while using as a TV or a gaming screen.  It is easy to operate, responds quickly, and is the perfect size for a bedroom or den.  So far, we are very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: is
Reviews.Content: Good picture,decent sound, good buy.  No need to waste time looking for another tv if your on a budget.  Get this one.

Reviews.Title: Great price and quality
Reviews.Author: Pennypincher
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my TV. I had compared this product against Vizio, Sony and Samsung. I believe this was best for the specs I wanted. I am not a pro on TV technology so this is based on experience of a lay-man. I am sure professional review would help you to understand how it better but I just want good TV experience.So with disclaimers above my experience:- Clear picture quality and good contrast. I did not like the contrast on Vizio TV. Samsung came close. Sony had poor refresh rate (always felt a little drag). I had checked all these brand at Target and so I knew exactly what I was looking for.- Sound is -1 star. It does not have clear sound so I have to listen at high volume. I just ordered good pair of speakers that works very well for me.Best part was the price. I ordered it on Warehouse deals and I got almost new like TV well packed and new condition. I was glad I didn't insist on new packaging and trust Warehouse Deals ratings.

Reviews.Title: Simply a great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Paljasma
Reviews.Content: This is simply a great TV. Bought it here for $300 and considering it is 32'' and quality brand I think it is excellent deal. Picture quality is remarkable (hooked up to Verizon FiOS TV), sound could be better but is not bad at all. Just buy one - you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV, easy purchase from Amazon
Reviews.Author: J. M. Mills "Eternal Student"
Reviews.Content: This TV is nicely priced, good quality, and very attractive. The screen is easy to see, and the personal control set up is done with ease. Cannot believe that we can get this type of product at a great price, with such a ease, online!

Reviews.Title: Great as a second TV
Reviews.Author: James Reilly "jgsamson"
Reviews.Content: Looking for a second TV for the Bed Room, the Panasonic VIERA L32C3 32 inch is the one. Has simple instructions and works great. The sleep timer is easy to operate, as well as all the other features.Unpacked it, plug it in and away I went, easy to set up and price is right. As a second TV, I give this a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: Quality 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "nevr"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for a digital signage display and it works great.  Can't really comment too much on the blacks because its never used for TV or movies, but the image quality is really good.  Panasonic continues to be one of the best bargains in the upper tier TV market.  Plus they are the most reliable TV's (and rated as such several years in the past 5 years).  At the price I got it for it was an absolute steal.  My only gripe really is the screws for the VESA mount were a little small, and it was basically impossible to find a commercially available screw to fit it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Moonlight Graham "Ben"
Reviews.Content: I picked up this TV to give me something to watch while jogging on the treadmill. I searched around awhile, and this one seemed to have pretty good reviews. I was able to mount in on the wall with the Cheetah Mounts ALAMLB LCD TV Wall Mount Bracket with Full Motion Swing Out Tilt and Swivel Articulating Arm. This was pretty easy to install. I was able to do it myself, but I would honestly recomment getting two people to mount it. You basically will need one person to hold the TV, which is pretty light, and while you are screwing it into the mount. It's easy enough to put the mount on the stud. The TV comes with the proper mounting screws to use to attach it to the bracket, so you won't have to worry about matching them up if you choose to mount it.The picture quality is really good. The colors are vibrant, and the sound is actually pretty good. I'll be hooking up some external speakers soon, but for now I can hear the TV jut fine while jogging. Motion on the screen is very smooth, and the picture is very crisp. I'm very pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: TnDon.
Reviews.Content: Researched many HDTV's and decided on this Panasonic model because it was affordable and my HD cable service is only 720P.  Very happy with the picture quality and the setup was easy.  Had it up and running in 20 minutes. Don't need web surfing on my TV as I have a computer for that.  Blue ray player is next purchase.  Love the HDMI hookups.  Would recommend this TV to anyone who wants HDTV quality at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Used for broadcast TV and DVD watching
Reviews.Author: michl
Reviews.Content: I use this without cable, i.e. for broadcast TV, as well as for DVDs. I've only had it about two weeks, and so far no problems. It looks a lot sleeker than my old Toshiba,but there is a limit to how good it can look. It's a TV. Delivery was as promised in two business days, and was free with signing for a trial Premium membership. WARNING: Premium will automatically upgrade to a PAID status in about a month, so be sure to go  into your account and unclick that option.

Reviews.Title: Happy I bought this one.
Reviews.Author: G. Nelson
Reviews.Content: This TV was exactly what I wanted for our bedroom to replace an older 27" tube TV. It took only a few minutes to set up and program for our cable co. remote. Great picture and sound quality for the size.

Reviews.Title: Great bargain
Reviews.Author: Fabian H. Cruz
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tv for several weeks, and I must say for the price point I received it has been a great value purchase. I mainly use it for the PS3 and the colors are full with good contrast and the sound is very good for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: bajester
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for my bedroom to replace the one my ex-wife took and the picture from an HD source is fantastic and I recommend this TV to everyone.  The picture quality is also very good when using a standard definition video.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for the Money
Reviews.Author: PKR
Reviews.Content: Bought as a replacement for an old tube set for elderly relative.  Easy hook-up.  Initially programmed it using the built-in initial setup, but this came up with too many channel repeats and far too much work to delete the duplicates.  So in my case I used Comcast digital converter just so the TV channels stayed the same.  Picture quality suffered a little, but worth it.  Too bad there is not a simplier solution.  Most of my grading is based on that initial setup, programming, and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: TV review
Reviews.Author: Duckman
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived on a Saturday and was delivered right to the area of my house where I wanted to hook it up. Can't beat not having to take time off from work to get it and needing to carry it from the store into my house. TV works fine and had a simple hook up.. The bottom line, the whole thing was a "no-brainer".

Reviews.Title: Price/quality excellent
Reviews.Author: Irish "Ray"
Reviews.Content: Looking at 20 or so LCD and LED tv's lined up side by side I found that all the 31 inch Tv's were just about the same in size and in picture performance but looking at the Panasonic LCD it was as good as any of the LED sets, The Panasonic palmas was a hair better but from what I understand  Palmas are not make under 42 inch.In my research and reading reviews over the years Panasonic has always been up there with the best.Many conplain's on the speakers  sounding like it's coming from a tin can on smaller sets, I find this set has excellent sound and picture with HD or without HD,  if you don't have HD don't worry picture will be fine.  Read where some still need to used two remote controls one to on/off and one to changes channels, for those who have Dish Satellite turn set on, top of remote 4 white buttons, press tv button, and hold until the remaining buttons flash release press 7-0-0 and the pound sign, turn set off/on, you may see on screen saying press "sat" button, don't know if this will work on all Panasonic sets or just the 31 inch.Had this set for about 8 weeks, would I buy this set again, you bet - will if Panasonic made a 31 inch palmas ?

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Timothy B. Daniel
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. Great picture. This is my second Viera and I have been very pleased. The first was a plasma and is still performing beautifully.  I got this one for a second TV and it is perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Television!
Reviews.Author: M. MacKaron
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of shopping before this purchase, and the Panasonic Viera clearly provided the most bang for the buck.  Setup was extremely simple, and the vibrancy of the picture is well beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: HDTV
Reviews.Author: Gene M. Sears Jr.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE QUALITY OF THE PICTURE. IT HAS A LOT OF FEATURES AND ALSO EASY TO SET UP. I WOULD RECOMEND THIS TV TO MY FRIENDS.

Reviews.Title: Nice bedroom tv!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I own a 42" Panasonic Viera plasma tv for my home and I wanted to get a flat screen that was a reliable brand, solid product, and good fit for my bedroom.  This tv fits the bill!  I was pleased with the price, shipping and delivery was amazingly fast, and it's worked very well for the reason that I got it!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 32in 720p Great
Reviews.Author: b.squared
Reviews.Content: **Updated July 14, 2013 - Read initial review first**I have had this tv for a short time so I am not able to review in depth.  However, in the future I will adjust my comments if necessary.I originally purchased the Vizio e-series LCD 32in 3D tv (twice) and returned it.  The Vizio had a loud hum or buzz that would happen when the brightness was NOT at 100.  I didn't want the brightness to be up at 100 all the time so I gave up on that tv and brand.  So I narrowed down the problem to be a bad power supply after constant researching.  I did more research and found either the panasonic 32in 720p LCD or LG LED 32in 720p.  I wanted a sharper image and the LG offered that but had one major drawback, which turned out to be the sound.  After reading the comments of some people not being able to stand the quality even though they were not expecting much was a major change in my selection.  Supposedly the speakers were 5 watts (not verified) and no bass.  I decided against the LG and purchased this Panasonic.+ Picture quality is very good on this TV for being a 720p LCD.+ Sound quality in my personal opinion is excellent when compared to other sets.+ Stand for the TV is higher quality (sturdy) compared to the Vizio plastic junk.+ Setup was simple+ Excellent for a bedroom+ Gets the job done- Would like to have more hdmi ports- Packaging was OK but Vizio had it better.  Vizio also included a screw driver Panasonic did not..- No other negatives at this timeIf you are on the edge about getting this television I would say go for it.  I would have to say you would enjoy it and the ratings for it show this is a quality tv.UPDATE MARCH 3, 2012I am giving an update on the panasonic after using it for a few months.  I stand by my original comments.  This TV for the price is amazing.  I would say the two biggest things that stand out the most today is sound and picture quality.  I have been using the TV regularly and notice that it takes maybe at most 5 seconds to turn on and have picture quality - pretty decent.  Menu to adjust settings is simple and I especially like how easy it is to sleep time the TV.  Simple to change the inputs from cable to HDMI - good response.  Hooked my PS3 up to the TV and and everything works great together.  I think Panasonic made a quality product and I would recommend this TV to anyone.UPDATE JULY 14, 2013I know most people may not review the product after the first week, month or year but I wanted to continue my updates on the Panasonic.  I received the TV back in December 2011 and would say it gets a fair amount of use.  The picture quality on the product is still great and the sound is still rockin.  I have noticed on minor issue with the TV..  When the volume on the TV hasn't been turned up or down in some time using the remote it will seem to respond extremely slow.  For example, I turn the TV volume up from the remote and receive a slight delay in the screen showing volume going from 5 up to 6.  I know this is not a major issue but one that I have noticed over time.  I still would recommend this if you find one at a low price.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TV
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Strohm
Reviews.Content: For the price it is a very good second TV.  I wouldnt hesitate to use it in a vacation home or a 2nd bedroom.  Sound quality is adequate at best.  Picture image is fine unless you are playing Bluray discs.  Remote requires quite a lot of critical reading.  Not bad.  However there are better quality image TVs out there for $60.00-$100.00 dollars more.Panasonic VIERA TC-L32C3 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTVI

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but....
Reviews.Author: K. Woods
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this TV is good and, as always, Amazon's service is great. However, the timer function stopped working a month after using it. I'm really upset about this but don't want to go through the hassle of returning it for another one.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Price Match policy
Reviews.Author: L. Lefczik "Cheap Larry"
Reviews.Content: Had I bought through Amazon.com (which I thought I did), I would have been able to get a refund of $21.33 according to the Amazon price matching policy.  But, since I did not realize I purchased from Paul's TV through Amazon (watch the words here), I am not able to get any refund or credit from Paul's TV or Amazon.  I contacted Customer Service of both and was refused.I did get a response from Amazon CS "Some items offered on our website by sellers (Amazon Merchants) are labeled "Fulfilled by Amazon." These items are shipped to you directly from an Amazon.com fulfillment center, and we take full responsibility for their safe and timely arrival. But we've no control over the listed item prices and the change of prices on the website depends upon the individual seller."I will definitely be careful where I make my next major purchase online.  Instead of blindly thinking I am buying from Amazon when I am on Amazon.com, I will read the FINE PRINT and search other sites, including E-Bay and Overstock.com, for a better deal.  While $21 may not seem like much money to companies like Amazon and Paul's TV, it is a large sum for the 85 year old buyer of this TV.  BUYER BEWARE!-----------As for the TV: I am still getting used to the menus and learning about the TV itself.  At this size, 720P seems the same as 1080i, so that is not an issue.  As a matter of fact, I can see a difference on my 60" between 720p and 1080i.I scanned my cable system feed directly into the Antenna connector to bypass the cable box since this cable box is not HD, but direct on cable is.  To watch HD I use the TV input, Video 4 for the rest of cable channels.One feature some TVs have is when manually storing channels, it displays the channel while stepping through to save or erase.  This set does not.  A little annoying while programming, but will not matter when done.Like I said, the cable box is not HD and found that this set does not have an S-Video input.  Again, not a big deal if you have an HD cable box.I am still looking to find how to get to the calibration menus for Gain and Bias so any tips would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Poor Audio
Reviews.Author: Brenda Gilbuena
Reviews.Content: For the price, this 32 inch tv had the best picture available compared to others around the same price. However, once we brought it home, the speakers were emitting sounds of static and clicking. Per the television manual, this is "standard" operation sounds. The louder I turned the television, the louder the static and clicking sounds. So terribly sad, this was a beautiful TV.

Reviews.Title: A great tv for a good price
Reviews.Author: Braun Shedd
Reviews.Content: I bought this T.V. to replace my long dying tube. I wanted a 32 inch tv with computer connectivity, good picture, and preferably name brand. I had been looking at a tcl, but I'd never heard of them before. Then, I spotted this tv for a smokin 300 dollars. Deal.I got the tv 6 days later. Easy to unpack, and above average manual. The tv has a small scratch on the screen I will note, but its not noticeable from farther than a foot away when the tv is off. I currently use it as a screen for my laptop, and it works great (note: if the screen has weird lines or is off center, change the resolution of the input on the tv to something different)Other than that, great tv overall

Reviews.Title: Good quality tv and will probably last many years
Reviews.Author: Daisy "Mel"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this television for about 2 months now and I'm happy with it.  The only thing that bothers me is the volume is low when I am watching something that has been recorded through my dvr and I have to sometimes turn the volume almost up to full strength.  But that could be a problem with my dvr and probably has nothing to do with the tv.  It's a Panasonic and I've always been happy with panasonic products.  I've tried to adjust the internal settings regarding this problem and have not found a solution, so I think it is the dvr and not the tv.  I believe it will last for many years to come and i'm happy with it.Update July 24, 2013,since I changed cable companies, there is no issue at all with the volume.  It was a problem with AT&T.;

Reviews.Title: Good bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Richard Allen
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom to use as a bedroom TV. The picture is great and the price was right. The speakers are a little quiet but that's a problem with lots of TVs this size.

Reviews.Title: love this TV
Reviews.Author: M. Pike
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our dining room so my wife can watch TV while cooking in the kitchen.  Works great and has a fantastic picture.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: RooRoo
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a bedroom.  The picture is awesome and the sound is good for a bedroom.  I only use it for satellite tv and it has been great so far.  I wish I had bought another!

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Sam Finfrock
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as an addition to my garage. The speed channel plays all day. The clarity is superb.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Bradley R. Mcdonald "Discerning male reader"
Reviews.Content: Great sound, easy to hook up and super picture.  What else do you want?  I will probably buy a larger screen for another room but Viera is my first choice.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera TV
Reviews.Author: Meh
Reviews.Content: I love this TV with a passion.  The clarity of the picture is unreal and it will be a year come this christmas that I've had it so I hope it continues to work as well as it has for many more years.  Panasonic is awesome at what they make, and they know how to make electronics.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size TV for my house.
Reviews.Author: Horses and Cows
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to upgrade my old, heavy, ugly Television.  It went to goodwill...My new Panasonic has a great picture, is light enough to move around when necessary, has all the bells and whistles I'll ever need and looks nice.  Set-up was easy, everything works right out of the box.  Oh, yeah, the box - this thing was packaged really really well.

Reviews.Title: stopped working after 1 year
Reviews.Author: O Chang
Reviews.Content: Was a decent TV, but just a couple weeks out of warranty the picture intermittently goes black and you only get audio. Sending it in for repair, but I'd expect a tv to last longer than a year before having problems. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dianne K. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV. Image is very nice, as is sound. It was easy to hook up. It has a very nice sturdy stand. I have used it with a cable box, wireless Apple TV, a DVD player and a Roku box. The remote control is easy to read--white letters/numbers against a black background, and a decent size font. Very pleased. If you can find it, buy it. Seems to be out of stock right now, so I'm glad I got one.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture quality
Reviews.Author: Romel
Reviews.Content: My 32" Panasonic VIERA is ideal for my small sitting room. Picture quality is amazing and when i connect my laptop via HDMI cable bluray rips are truly vivid and colour amazing. Only thing missing is a USB port. Other than that, Had it about a month so far and no regrets....so far.

Reviews.Title: charpatt
Reviews.Author: charpatt
Reviews.Content: a great buy for a very good price. i was able to get 1080 hd on this set with directv although it is listed as 720p.picture is very good with a very easy setup. sound is very good for this tv. i paid $300 at amazon and now they want $400. price always goes up on a good thing.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Item
Reviews.Author: Glenn E. Keller
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic item and a wonderful price.  It arrived in only 2 days and is perfect!  I would buy this item again if a second one was needed!

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: marva charles
Reviews.Content: love this t.v. picture is crisp and clear and does everything it says it will do.would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: I liked the first one so much I bought two more
Reviews.Author: Nobody
Reviews.Content: The extra two TVs were gifts for family members and they're as happy with theirs as I am with mine. The picture is excellent and so is the sound. My TV room is too small for a large screen TV. This size is just right when viewing from about twelve feet away -- plenty big enough. Something else I appreciate about the quality of the TV's picture is that it doesn't fade out when sunlight is streaming into my media room. The same can't be said for other TVs I've owned.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic reliability
Reviews.Author: Joe Summers
Reviews.Content: Yep - does what you expect from a Panasonic - easily set up and great picture. An ideal companion for it's big brother 42" Viera.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: This television has a great picture!  I was very impressed. You can really see the picture from every angle which with a lot of flat screen TV's you just can't.  I think it was a great value for the price and would certainly recommend purchasing this model.

Reviews.Title: 32 Inch TV

Reviews.Title: Great value, good picture and sound, easy to set up
Reviews.Author: J. A. Quayle
Reviews.Content: We wanted a HDTV for the bedroom to replace an old SD CRT TV.  We wanted value with a good picture and sound.  This fit the bill perfectly and was set up in minutes.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: brenda "open door"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace a smaller, older set in my bedroom.  I have been trying to wean myself from cable so I put in roku and an antenna and was good to go.  I am an older lady (I guess we're called seniors) and live alone.  This TV was easy to asssemble and set up and was light weight enough that I could put it in place without help.  So far I love it. I love it that it has a timer so I can feel easy about falling asleep while watching a late night movie.  It will turn off on it's own.  I love that.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, Great price
Reviews.Author: Mitzu the Shih Tzu
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price! We wanted a tv for the guest bedroom and this was perfect! The high definition channels have resolution and sharp pictures that rival our 55 inch Sony 3D tv. Also the SD card slot is a nice added feature.

Reviews.Title: Good TV and value
Reviews.Author: Gene W.
Reviews.Content: I got this to rest in an armoire in our master bedroom, and it fits perfectly. The TV's image, for a 720, is rich and detailed, with good blacks, and I just think it's a very good value. I was going to give it four stars, but then I remembered that I need to rate it for what it is. For a 720-pixel system, it rates five. Reviews.Title: Good Value

Reviews.Title: Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Stu
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for about a week now and I really love it! I only did a small amount of product research ahead of time before the purchase but this one seemed like the go-to product for the price and it really is! Great TV for HD. Nice features as well!

Reviews.Title: Just right for me just now.
Reviews.Author: Dan-0
Reviews.Content: We chose this to replace a bulky old CRT 32 inch TV.  It is possible to use a larger (up to 40 inch) TV in this size room but the 32 inch avoids the next price move up.This new LCD picture is superior, sound superior- it makes my brothers Vizio and LG LCDs look pitiful. Set up was a snap, user controls quickly learned, energy use greatly reduced.It matches or exceeds my basic cable signal capabilities.I don't always agree with the automatic contrast adjustment so usually leave it off.Wish the remote were backlit or had "glow in dark" keys.I upgraded my surge protector now that I have a TV worth protecting.I am a long time fan of Panasonic, Sony, Toshiba basic family home (non high end) products for balance of cost and features plus dependablity.

Reviews.Title: BEAUTIFUL, CRISP,  PICTURE!!!
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Rose "mommy rose"
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing. Wonderful tv for our bedroom. We couldn't be happier with Panasonic. It's a hight quality brand that we love!

Reviews.Title: totally satisfied - great, luxurious picture, low price
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I got this 32 inch 720p HDTV along with the Samsung BluRay Disc player- the BluRay player includes wifi connectivity and the ability to stream Netflix, MLB.Com, and play standard media files from a networked PC or DLNA drive, etc.  Everything works beautifully, even connecting my older T60 Thinkpad laptop via VGA to play movies or whatever via the laptop.  Of course that isn't a widescreen laptop, so playing in 4:3 mode on the flatscreen gives you a true image - and I'm really surprised at the clarity, colors, etc.  Very natural, and very satisfying.  If you do stretch that output to Full mode, the actors definitely put on a few pounds. :pWith a standard widescreen DVD in the BlueRay player (or a BluRay disc, of course), the image is great.  Amazing, in fact, for the price.  I don't have it connected to cable or over the air TV yet, but that should also be fine.Sound is good enough - far better than many with built in sound - we might upgrade one day to an AV reciever, but for the moment, it's definitely ok.  Wish there was a way to hook up to the 2.1 PC sound system we have, but there's only HDMI and optical audio out.  Of course with a laptop as the input, we can still use the 2.1 system.If you're on the fence, this is the best budget tv I could imagine. Total cost - a little over 400, including the blu-ray player, not including the HDMI cable (I went with a Monster cable just because). Took me a long time and a lot of amazon reviews to decide, and I'm really glad we chose this.  Way to go, Panasonic, and thank you, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: 32" Panasonic HDTV
Reviews.Author: E. Griffin
Reviews.Content: The TV came incredibly fast. It was in great condition. It was quick to set-up and operated great once we reset the Satellite box to the correct channel to be compatible with the Panasonic TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Florida gal
Reviews.Content: We're pretty happy with this television. The picture quality is very clear, and the price was great. The only complaint is that it does not support 1020 HD videos from Netflicks/Vudu...you have to choose SD/720. Also, there is an energy saver function on it that causes the tv to delay coming on for about five seconds when you press power, so sometimes you think you didn't press the power on, and then you end up shutting it off again. Reviews.Title: GREAT tv!

Reviews.Content: Bought this tv at Best Buy for $299, which was about 50 bucks cheaper than many of the 26" models. As other reviewers have noted, the sound quality is really good even w/out speakers. The tv is easy to set up and program. Definitely worth the money! Reviews.Title: Great television!
Reviews.Author: D. Negron
Reviews.Content: My big tube 32inch tv broke in my bedroom, and I got the TC-l32C3 and I must say I'm really satisfied. Picture quality is really great and the factory settings are actually perfect. I just made it less brighter because my eyes are a bit sensitive and I set the bass and treble settings and everything is perfect. I own a 46inch Sony that I have in the living room. But this Panasonic 32inch set is perfect for the bedroom. I don't think you'll be disappointed with this model and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Great television for the money
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research looking for a unit that combined value with performance.  The price was outstanding and I was more than happy with the overall quality.  Picture with hd box and hdmi cable is on par with all the best i've seen and the interface for set up was simple.  Sound quality is great but overall volume leaves a little something to be desired....as is usual with most thin flat panels.  Definitely worth the money overall and will not disappoint. Reviews.Title: Atrocious color & sound could be far better
Reviews.Author: tpsbmam
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about 4 months ago.  Unfortunately, receiving it coincided with me being newly released from the hospital and still sick.  I noticed the issue with the color pretty fast, but didn't return it out of pure exhaustion.  So that part is my fault.As for the sharpness of the picture, it's fine.  I don't know that it's as good as the five star reviews, but I don't have a lot to compare it to.  This is my first LCD TV -- I've managed to get along with my old, pre-flatscreen TVs up 'til now.  I don't see a ton of difference between the regular TV/cable stations & HDTV.  Again, I've never had an HDTV before and don't know what I should be seeing -- my impression had been that there's a significant difference.  I have the equivalent of HDTV on my computer (or I have HDTV -- I don't know) and watched the entire HDTV version of "The Tudors" series on my computer through Amazon Prime instant videos.  I was amazed at how vibrant & crisp the video was -- there was a very noticeable difference between what I normally see on TV (including this TV on HDTV stations) and what I saw on my computer.  (I do have HDTV through my cable company -- it's included in my package for premium stations.)The sound issue is mostly pertinent to those of us with hearing challenges, which includes me.  I find the sound to be weaker than expected given the reviews here.  Now, I've read a ton of reviews of LED/LCD and other flatscreen TV types.  Sound appears to frequently be an issue.  Given the reviews here, I was encouraged that this TV might be an exception.  As for as I'm concerned, the sound is pretty pathetic.  Whereas I'd turn the volume up on my old Sony to maybe 1/4 of its sound capacity to hear it clearly, I find myself turning this TV up to 80%+ of its sound capacity.  Once or twice I've had to turn it up to the maximum 100!  The maximum sound figure is 100 -- on many movies/shows, I have the sound set at 80 or above.  The same comparison holds for the older Panasonic TV I have in the bedroom.  When I turn it up so that all dialogue is clear in the maximum setting I've needed, it's also at about 1/4 of the TV's sound capacity.Finally, the color.  I have to adjust the color on most programs I watch.  The default color is awful.  White skin is FAR redder than it actually is.  I almost inevitably have to adjust both the tint to make skin a more realistic tone and color to adjust the intensity of the color, which is too high in the default setting, contributing to part of the intense redness of skin tone in the defaults.  Now, this wouldn't be a big issue if I only had to do it once and it held for all programs/movies.  Sadly, I have to do it for every program/movie I watch.  The color & tint as I've set them don't hold across programs.  A setting for one movie/show ends up being completely wrong for another.  White skin tone pretty close to reality becomes orange or reddish in another, necessitating another adjustment.  Heck, it doesn't even hold within the same show/movie.  WIth lighting changes come sometimes pretty drastic skin tone changes.  At that point I say the hell with it and watch it at the current setting.Now, it's possible I got a lemon.  I don't know.  But I wanted to add my review to the grouping here to help people make their decisions about which TV to buy.  I know that reviews help me make decisions, and I appreciate being able to read both the good and bad.  I think this is only my first or second one star rating.  I'm not terribly picky most of the time.  This TV, in my view, has definitely earned its one star.

Reviews.Title: Not great for use with a PC
Reviews.Author: Michael in NY
Reviews.Content: Had problems using the TV as a monitor. The actual resolution of the TV is 1366x768.1280x1024 is OK but a bit fuzzy as you would expect as there are only 768 vertical pixels, forcing the TV to throw some away.1024x600 from a Netbook computer looked fine but with black stripes above and below the windows desktop.1024x768 looked fine, but it is, as expected, stretched horizontally when viewed full screen and thus looks strange, clear, but strange.800x600 is OK but really a waste of a higher definition panel.But the only resolution I care about is 1280x768 which should work just fine. All the TV has to do is use all its vertical pixels and ignore a few horizontal pixels on the sides. But, the TV looks miserable at this resolution, far far worse than any of the above. Not only is text fuzzy, the picture is not centered and data on the left side of the screen is chopped off. And, there is a shimmy across the bottom of the screen. Completely unusable.I tried four different Windows laptops (Windows XP and 7) and two different VGA cables and all the results have been the same. Two of the laptop computers used Intel video hardware, one used ATI and one used NVidia, yet the TV was consistently unusable at 1280x768.This is a supported resolution. All computers were using 60 Hertz as the manual says they should. I'm feeding analog output from the laptops to the VGA analog input on the TV.Not sure if its a bad TV or some other problem.The VGA input port on the TV is also poorly positioned - the VGA plug sticks out from the back of the TV. These plugs tend to be big and heavy. A much better position would allow for the VGA plug to run vertically rather than horizontally.UPDATE 1: I finally got the 1280x768 resolution to look reasonably OK with some tweaking of the TV picture settings. Strange how this was not required with any of the other resolutions. It sill does not look great, but some more tweaking may be needed. Sadly, some of the PC adjustments such as Dot Clock and Clock Phase are not explained in the manual.UPDATE 2: I tried another computer, also analog VGA input, but with a resolution of 1360x768. You would think the monitor would display the 1360 horizontal pixels and ignore 3 pixels on each end. If that's what its doing, the picture was still a bit fuzzy. And, I finally rounded up a computer that was capable of the full native resolution: 1366x768 and the picture was again disappointing, by which I mean that all the text was not sharp and clear. Some was, most was, but not all.Conclusion: don't plan on using this TV as a computer monitor with analog VGA input. I have not tried any digital inputs to the TV.

It did not matter that the product was still in warranty when it FAILED. I had a Confirmation from panasonic dated 3/12/12 as the date reported.  So with this be very carefull when buying a panasonic.  1. The item WILL fail and when it does, do not wait to get panasonic to stand behind their product.  2. Reviews.Author: Sean Middleton
Reviews.Content: I bought this television and returned it days later (by the way, thanks Amazon for making returns easy).Problem was after watching the TV for a couple of minutes the picture would turn off and a blinking red light would stay on.  The manual said this was the TV's way of protecting itself against power surges.  So I tried plugging in the TV through a surge strip and then on a dedicated circuit.  Same problems.  So I called Panasonic's help number.  Clearly the woman wasn't interested in diagnosing the problem because she said it must be the firmware and she would send me a chip in the mail to upgrade it.  Now, if it WAS the firmware then every television with that version of the firmware on it would have had problems (which doesn't seem to have been the case).  She said I would get the chip in 1-2 weeks.  WEEKS!  I could get a new TV to me the next day for $4 with Amazon Prime.  So I did.  Wasn't the Panasonic though.  And the upgrade chip... it never came.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Horrible Service from Panasonic
Reviews.Author: KillerWhale
Reviews.Content: The TV is fine.  The picture/sound quality are a little better than I expected for a $300 TV.  Why one star?  This TV was purchased for a child moving to college.  It was delivered in a new, sealed, undamaged box.  Rather than inspecting the contents, I loaded the boxed TV with her other belongings, and we moved her into the dorm, several hours from home...  I've set up many LCD TVs in the past, so don't normally need to read instructions -- but on this model, I couldn't figure it out -- there was a revised set of instructions for installing the stand (that just said "old" and "revised," other than that was just pictures), but the package lacked the screws indicated in either set of instructions..  Screws included didn't fit.  Now, I find myself several hours from home, with a TV that I can't set up, and a kid who would likely hurt herself with a screwdriver if she had to install it later (great student, not so handy).I called the toll-free number for Panasonic, and this is where it got fun...  I was hoping that maybe the missing screws were for some reason already in part of the TV, and maybe I was just missing them.  I got through right away, explained my situation (that sending me new parts wouldn't resolve the issue), asking if it was possible that the screws were somewhere else...  He explained that he would need to put me on hold.  After about 5 mins on hold, I went down to my car, and started to drive to the nearest hardware store.  After about 10 mins on hold, I hung up.  The local ACE Hardware was great -- helped me find the right screws, charged me a whopping $1.08.  When I got back to the car, I had a voicemail from Mr. ForeverHold at Panasonic, who advised that all I would need to do is fax my receipt and the page from the manual that indicated the missing parts, and they would gladly REVIEW, then mail the missing parts to me...  You want a faxed receipt for 4 screws that cost a total of $1 at retail? I wish I had been in a position to simply return the TV.  Being out of town, just trying to get the kid setup then get out of her way, this wasn't an option.  As I said in my first sentence, I think the TV is fine, but manufacturers need to be accountable for including products in their boxes.  Mistakes can happen, as they did, but SERVICE comes when you resolve your mistake by exceeding your customer expectations.  In this case Panasonic didn't come close to meeting my needs.  Obviously, as I explained, mailing them to me, even if they didn't decide I should fax them some documents, wouldn't work.  Sending a small check for my inconvenience?  Would that have been too much for them to offer?  I guess so.I can't do much, other than write to Panasonic to whine, and resolve to never buy from Panasonic again.  My only fun option is to write this to try to get one person to avoid purchasing a Panasonic product.  Hope it works.  Dear Panasonic: This isn't service -- you had a chance to resolve an issue very easily, but you chose to drop the ball.
